name: Villa Canto Grihet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved our stay at Villa Canto Grihet. We felt at home from the start, with the owner, Claude France, warmly welcoming us to the Villa. She was a wonderful host who went out of her way to give us good tips on where to go and what to do.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant

reviews.text: We stayed in the Traou Madame room (the orange one on the website) which was lovely. We could also make use of their kitchen/dining/lounge area which is on the same floor as the guest bedrooms which was very handy, as it allowed us to save some money and eat in on a couple of nights. However, there are some wonderful restaurants in the Old Town of Vence, which is 5-10 minutes walk away from the villa. St Paul de Vence is also a 5 minute bus or car ride, and this also has nice places to eat.
reviews.title: Perfect Location and Lovely Owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those without a car, the villa is 5 minutes walk to the bus stop wich takes you to various places including St Paul de Vence and Nice. The bus is 1 euro per person wherever you go, a very cheap ride to Nice and no worries about parking.
reviews.title: An oasis in the village of Vence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is lovely as are the gardens. Breakfast was wonderful with a good spread of food and very relaxing. We enjoyed catching up with the other guests as well as Claude France and her family who were visiting.
reviews.title: A wonderful base to a wonderful part of the world

reviews.text: We can't wait to return on our next visit to France.
reviews.title: perfect location

likes.disliked: — small amount of road noise, but did not detract from the location of the accommodation

reviews.text: Wonderful bed and breakfast. We so enjoyed our lovely room and the beautiful garden which was the perfect place to relax. The breakfasts at Canto Grihet were a delight and included local breads and jams. Claude France is a warm and caring person who suggested places to visit that were not in our guide books and even provided us with a couple of maps. We will always remember the violette ice cream. We are so happy that we chose Canto Grihet for our Cote d'Azur vacation.
reviews.title: Delightful Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Canto Grihet was the perfect location on a longer trip in France. My husband and I had never visited southern France and we'll be back. When we visit again we're sure to stay here! Claude France was wonderful, warm, welcoming and knowledgeable. She gave us such great suggestions for seeing the region--places not highlighted in our travel books that were by far our favorite sites during our visit. Vence is wonderful and I would highly recommend it over St. Paul de-Vence. The Villa is a very short walk from the charming old part of the city. It was a short drive down to the beach, but I would recommend the drive to the other mountain top villages. Claude France can recommend. The rooms were lovely (we stayed in the baou room, which had a wonderful view of the stars), a perfect size, and the yard and home were really spectacular. This is such a gem and affordable, we highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Perfect Cote d'Azur Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Canto Grihet for a get-away weekend, leaving the kids behind. It was everything we had hoped. The hostess Claude France was enjoyable and knowledgeable. She prepared for us a wonderful breakfast of fresh baked regional bread, jams and fruits that we enjoyed in her garden. The location was perfect, within walking distance to great restaurants and art galleries. Even though the villa is located close to town, you still feel as if you have escaped to a rural country estate. It was quite and peaceful. Our room was the "Baou" room, which was very romantic with skylights and a beautiful olive wood bathtub. I have no negative aspects to point out, and would love to stay again. I can even see bringing our young children with us next time, as Claude France encourages families and has plenty of space for them to enjoy.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: In general, I would definitely recommend staying in Vence as compared to St. Paul de Vence, which is swarming with tourists and cruise-ship busses. St. Paul is however a worthy side trip and within a 10-minute drive from Vence. An even better side trip would be a visit to Eze... an incredible site. Bon Voyage!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Bed and Breakfast in Vence

likes.liked: — the beauty of the property and its location
likes.disliked: — there's some street noise from the rooms

description: Comfort and calm at a five-minute-walk from the medieval city in a typical provencal renovated familly villa : original decoration, nice views, spacious living room for the guests, large garden with a swimming pool and plenty of old trees, private parking. Open all the year long. Bedrooms from 75 to 110 euros; suite from 110 to 145 euros; an independent cottage for seasonnal rental from 600 to 800 euros per week.
